intro: Sphaerine linifolia, commonly known as the silverleaf sphaerine, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its dense, silver-gray foliage that reflects sunlight, helping it to reduce water loss in arid environments. Its small, star-shaped flowers are typically white or pale yellow, blooming in spring. Sphaerine linifolia is well adapted to rocky soils and full sun, making it a hardy choice for xeriscaping.
